memory_entries.value: MTCA prioritizes student autonomy supported by clear structure rather than rigid enforcement. Tools should guide behavior without blocking progress or creating anxiety for students.
Coach visibility should focus on patterns and risks, not day-to-day monitoring of student activity. Oversight should feel supportive, not supervisory.
The College List feature will use a Kanban-style layout to visually represent progress without enforcing a strict sequence of steps.
Students will not be blocked from skipping stages in the College List, but the UI will encourage best practices through defaults and soft guidance.
All dates entered in the College List are considered student-reported goals and will not be treated as authoritative audition deadlines.
The College List tool should not replace or diminish the role of coaches like Amy; it must coexist with and enhance existing advising workflows.
Version one of the College List should avoid predictive analytics or acceptance modeling to prevent unnecessary pressure or false certainty for students.
Students often track college research informally in spreadsheets or notes before using formal tools, leading to fragmented or outdated information.
Overly technical language in student-facing interfaces reduces engagement and increases confusion, even when functionality is sound.
Terminology such as 'Prescreen' may need to be revisited for student-facing views to ensure clarity and emotional accessibility.
